location.name: Hybrid - local to Washington, D.C. metro

title: Enterprise Security Architect, SME 4203
content:
MetroStar is an award-winning IT management consulting firm that works with over 20+ Federal sector clients across law enforcement, foreign affairs, military, and regulatory. We are looking for an Enterprise Security Architect, SME who is passionate about bringing creative architect solutions to end customers.If you want to join a company that values people that are fearless about making technology work and are open to remote work, occasionally commuting to Washington DC, we want you to work for MetroStar!
Don’t meet every single Must Have? If you’re excited about this role, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to go ahead and apply. Studies have shown that women, people of color and the LGBTQ+ community are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At MetroStar, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic culture and we pride ourselves on making great matches. Best of luck! – The MetroStar People & Culture Team
You're a great fit if:

You have experience designing, analyzing, and complex enterprise infrastructures to include on-prem, cloud, and custom-based tools and technologies
You offer thought leadership to drive executive level clients forward in IT modernization planning and implementation
You are experienced in developing whitepapers, proof of concept solutions, and have demonstrated experience in translating these types of activities into growth
You have experience in Enterprise IT and Infrastructure

You'll love this opportunity if: (This is the stuff you MUST have to be a fit)

You have 5+ years of experience leading high profile cybersecurity enterprise architecture projects
You direct experience implementing Zero Trust security architectures
You have 2-5 years of experience performing Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) security functions and have experience deploying and configuring Active Directory, LDAP, and SSO
You have 2-5 years of experience performing ICAM functions for Federal IT systems
You possess the ability to work independently/with minimal oversight
You have a solid background and knowledge of the common service offerings within ICAM technologies
You have the ability to obtain and maintain DHS Suitability

We'll REALLY love you if: (This is the bonus stuff that makes you stand out)

You have CISSP, CISA, and/or Certified System Engineer ICAM PACS
You have experience with Sailpoint, Okta, CyberArk, Azure/AWS, LDAP, SSO, Federations
You have familiarity with data analytics, cloud, virtualization, remote access and mobile technologies
You're a team player, passionate, and have a strong work ethic!

What your day will look like:

You'll provide architectural guidance, technical support, and advisement services to ensure identity management system technologies are integrated and meeting the appropriate security requirements
You will engage with senior level executives at a public facing Federal agency and provide subject matter expertise in security architecture and other key domain areas
You'll support ICAM integrations, reporting, and provides recommendations external ICAM systems as well as providing required information/reports for ICAM reporting requirements

The Admin Stuff:  In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.
The Legal Stuff:  MetroStar Systems is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of MetroStar Systems.
